title: Instructional Design for Strengthening Numeracy Literacy and Math Self-Concept in Children with Special Needs: Focus on Calculation, Formulas, and Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level expertise in the field (mathematics education theory, analysis of special education needs) and extensive practical experience (designing problem-solving strategies for children with learning disabilities)
context.additional_context: Strengthens differentiated learning strategy design competencies to improve special education students' numeracy skills (basic calculation, shape recognition, measurement techniques) and self-awareness (mathematical confidence, problem-solving willingness).

learning_goals: Learners can develop an assessment tool to diagnose numeracy literacy levels in special education students, evaluating basic calculation skills and formula comprehension.
Design three or more differentiated learning activities to enhance mathematical self-concept: including equation-solving, graph utilization, and real-world problem-solving activities
Apply blended teaching strategies to support large learner groups in online environments: establish a personalized feedback system utilizing probability and statistics concepts
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
